headline.main: Kennedy Children Come Home While Staff and Friends Rally

results.snippet: McLEAN, Va., June 5 -- Today was almost like any other day at Hickory Hill, the McLean home of Senator Robert F. Kennedy. Fourteen-year-old Bobby Jr. played with friends, and members of the Senator's staff rallied around the children at the six-acre...

byline.original: By MYRA MacPHERSONSpecial to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: McLEAN, Va., June 5 -- Today was almost like any other day at Hickory Hill, the McLean home of Senator Robert F. Kennedy. Fourteen-year-old Bobby Jr. played with friends, and members of the Senator's staff rallied around the children at the six-acre compound.

headline.main: Glenn Attempts to Cheer Up the Kennedy Children

results.snippet: McLEAN, Va., June 6 (UPI) -- John H. Glenn Jr., the former astronaut, attempted to cheer up the seven youngest children of Robert F. Kennedy today by playing touch football and taking a dip in the swimming pool at Hickory Hill, the Senator's estate...
results.lead_paragraph: McLEAN, Va., June 6 (UPI) -- John H. Glenn Jr., the former astronaut, attempted to cheer up the seven youngest children of Robert F. Kennedy today by playing touch football and taking a dip in the swimming pool at Hickory Hill, the Senator's estate in this suburb of Washington.

headline.main: THOUSANDS IN LAST TRIBUTE TO KENNEDY; SERVICE AT ARLINGTON IS HELD AT NIGHT; JOHNSON AT RITES

results.snippet: New York bade a solemn but strangely joyful farewell yesterday to Robert Francis Kennedy, who in death had come to symbolize many people's hopes for a fresh breath of life.
results.lead_paragraph: New York bade a solemn but strangely joyful farewell yesterday to Robert Francis Kennedy, who in death had come to symbolize many people's hopes for a fresh breath of life.

headline.main: Former Kennedy Aides and Adversaries Among 2,300 at St. Patrick's Rites; GUESTS REFLECT WIDE INTERESTS

results.snippet: Government officials, organizers of protest, former associates and adversaries, an astronaut and a sprinkling of scientists and entertainers were among the mourners for Robert F. Kennedy in St. Patrick's Cathedral yesterday morning.
results.lead_paragraph: Government officials, organizers of protest, former associates and adversaries, an astronaut and a sprinkling of scientists and entertainers were among the mourners for Robert F. Kennedy in St. Patrick's Cathedral yesterday morning.

results.abstract: R F Kennedy buried near his grave; Mrs J F Kennedy and children, after service, place wreaths on Pres Kennedy's grave

headline.main: President Joins Kennedys In Tribute at Graveside; Service for Kennedy Is Held in Arlington at Night With Johnson Joining in Tribute

results.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 8 -- Senator Robert F. Kennedy was buried tonight in the glow of floodlights, not far from President Kennedy's grave on the hillside at Arlington National Cemetery.
results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 8 -- Senator Robert F. Kennedy was buried tonight in the glow of floodlights, not far from President Kennedy's grave on the hillside at Arlington National Cemetery.

headline.main: WIDOW REVISITS KENNEDY GRAVE; 4 Children Accompany Her -- 15,000 Others File By

results.snippet: ARLINGTON, Va., June 10 (UPI) -- Mrs. Robert F. Kennedy and four of her children returned to the grave of her husband at Arlington National Cemetery this evening after the gates were closed to other visitors.
results.lead_paragraph: ARLINGTON, Va., June 10 (UPI) -- Mrs. Robert F. Kennedy and four of her children returned to the grave of her husband at Arlington National Cemetery this evening after the gates were closed to other visitors.

results.snippet: THE motives for writing a biography for young readers are probably much the same as for writing one for adult readers. Sometimes the subject is topical, or much in the news -- a baseball hero, an astronaut, a martyred President -- and both publisher...
results.lead_paragraph: THE motives for writing a biography for young readers are probably much the same as for writing one for adult readers. Sometimes the subject is topical, or much in the news -- a baseball hero, an astronaut, a martyred President -- and both publisher and author want to "cash in" on the public interest.

results.abstract: Pres Johnson asks Cong to require natl regis of every firearm and a license for every gun owner whose state does not enforce Fed license standards, message to Cong; proposals, which will be submitted as a bill, require natl regis to permit Natl Crime Information Center of the FBI to compile a comprehensive computer file of every gun in US punish states that do not establish effective license systems for gun owners by depriving them of funds from Wildlife and Conservation Trust Fund; Tydings hails bill, has formally offered his own like proposals; Col J H Glenn Jr leads many prominent citizens in nationwide write-in-campaign organized by Emergency Com for Gun Control; com discloses Vice Pres Humphrey and Gov Rockefeller have responded favorably to its request for support from all Pres candidates; orgn's exec com to be composed of T J Watson Jr, A Stevenson 3d, J W Gardner, C Evers, J V Bennett

headline.main: PRESIDENT CALLS FOR REGISTERING OF ALL FIREARMS; PLEA TO CONGRESS Bill, Due Today, Also to Require Licensing of Gun Owners PRESIDENT URGES NEW GUN CONTROL

results.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 24 -President Johnson asked Congress today to require the national registration of every firearm and a license for every gun owner whose state does not enforce Federal license standards.

byline.original: By MAX FRANKELSpecial to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 24 -President Johnson asked Congress today to require the national registration of every firearm and a license for every gun owner whose state does not enforce Federal license standards.

results.abstract: about 20 hippies, in apparent effort to show that 'underground press' is superior to established media, break into WNDT studio during program on underground press; disrupt program, often with on-camera obscenities, for 15 mins; 7 arrested; panelists on program were M Fishman, A Katzman and J Shero; Fishman lauds group

headline.main: 20 Hippies Invade TV Show and Shout Obscenities on Air; 20 HIPPIES INVADE CHANNEL 13 SHOW

results.snippet: About 20 hippies broke into the studios of Channel 13, the educational television station here, and disrupted the "News-front" program -- often with on-camera obscenities -- for about 15 minutes last night.
results.lead_paragraph: About 20 hippies broke into the studios of Channel 13, the educational television station here, and disrupted the "News-front" program -- often with on-camera obscenities -- for about 15 minutes last night.

headline.main: Ramsey Clark Urges Senators to Support the Registration of Firearms; Ramsey Clark Backs Gun Registration

results.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 26 -- Attorney General Ramsey Clark told a Senate subcommittee today that Congress would be failing in its responsibility to check crime if it did not include registration and licensing of firearms in a gun control bill.

byline.original: By JOHN W. FINNEYSpecial to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 26 -- Attorney General Ramsey Clark told a Senate subcommittee today that Congress would be failing in its responsibility to check crime if it did not include registration and licensing of firearms in a gun control bill.

headline.main: The Battle Goes on For Still Gun Controls

results.snippet: WASHINGTON -- As the White House well appreciates, no word is quite so likely to trigger the large-caliber, noisy and effective propaganda machine of the gun lobby as "registration."
results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON -- As the White House well appreciates, no word is quite so likely to trigger the large-caliber, noisy and effective propaganda machine of the gun lobby as "registration."

results.snippet: WASHINGTON -- After a brief July Fourth recess this week, a slow-moving, weary 90th Congress will head into the homestretch for adjournment, struggling in the final weeks to find a way to pay the nation's bills and still economize.
results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON -- After a brief July Fourth recess this week, a slow-moving, weary 90th Congress will head into the homestretch for adjournment, struggling in the final weeks to find a way to pay the nation's bills and still economize.
